document.webtitle: Atkins Food and Cooking Chat Fried Chicken = High Carb Count?
document.description: Your life will never change until you change your ... salt and pepper? That's what the carb count will be! ... carb counts from breaded chicken bought at a fast food restaurant.
document.body:

August 31st, 2010, 11:15 PM #1 Cameronc ADBB Amateur Atkins Phase: 14-day Induction
Join Date Aug 30, 2010 Posts 9 Rep Power 0 Fried Chicken = High Carb Count? I've searched a few sources and it seems as though Fried Chicken Thighs have high carb counts?
Where are these carbs coming from?
Chicken thighs, seasoned with Salt&Pepper and deep fried?
(from another forum) Fried chicken drumsticks or thighs 2 pieces (about 5 1/4 oz.) 15.7 g Share Share this post on Digg Del.icio.us Technorati Twitter
Reply With Quote August 31st, 2010 11:15 PM # ADS A word from our sponsor Circuit advertisement Join Date Always Posts Many August 31st, 2010, 11:32 PM #2 atkinsgal08 ADBB Admiral Atkins Phase: Maintenance
Join Date Aug 23, 2007 Posts 8,307 Blog Entries 14 Rep Power 111 Re: Fried Chicken = High Carb Count? If you're using a site like Fitday, they're assuming the chicken is breaded or dusted with flour, which is where the carbs are coming from.
Why don't you just look up the carbs counts for the chicken, salt and pepper? That's what the carb count will be! Share Share this post on Digg Del.icio.us Technorati Twitter
J .
Your life will never change until you change your choices.
Atkins since 2003, maintenance since 2005
Reply With Quote August 31st, 2010, 11:56 PM #3 Cameronc ADBB Amateur Atkins Phase: 14-day Induction
Join Date Aug 30, 2010 Posts 9 Rep Power 0 Re: Fried Chicken = High Carb Count? Originally Posted by atkinsgal08 If you're using a site like Fitday, they're assuming the chicken is breaded or dusted with flour, which is where the carbs are coming from.
Why don't you just look up the carbs counts for the chicken, salt and pepper? That's what the carb count will be! True.... but even searching another very popular LC Forum, showed the results above. I knew something had to be amiss...
Thanks!
Fried Chicken Thighs = 0.00 Carbs! Share Share this post on Digg Del.icio.us Technorati Twitter
Reply With Quote September 1st, 2010, 12:29 AM #4 mission to lose Moderator Atkins Phase: OWL Rung 4
Join Date Feb 21, 2004 Location Southern California Posts 11,822 Images 13 My Mood Rep Power 803 Re: Fried Chicken = High Carb Count? A low carb forum lists carb counts? Can you elaborate? Or was it a person on a low carb forum posting a carb count? Share Share this post on Digg Del.icio.us Technorati Twitter
x14 K ​ Start 8/10/09 Today's Total -64#
Journal- http://www.atkinsdietbulletinboard.c...ilding-me.html
"Doing Atkins, you'll find that you're cleaning out a lot of metabolic garbage from your life, in addition to excess pounds and junk food. Many of my patients have discovered that instead of a weight loss program,this is for them a rejuvenation program." Reply With Quote September 1st, 2010, 12:08 PM #7 not2late Moderator Atkins Phase: Pre-maintenance
Join Date May 09, 2003 Location Pre-Maintenance Posts 17,835 My Mood Rep Power 319 Re: Fried Chicken = High Carb Count? Originally Posted by Cameronc I've searched a few sources and it seems as though Fried Chicken Thighs have high carb counts?
Where are these carbs coming from?
Chicken thighs, seasoned with Salt&Pepper and deep fried?
(from another forum) Fried chicken drumsticks or thighs 2 pieces (about 5 1/4 oz.) 15.7 g Are you making these thighs yourself or are you purchasing them? Share Share this post on Digg Del.icio.us Technorati Twitter
~Megs~ 242/141/124-126 dress size 26/10/8 5'4", Female, May 2, 2003 My blog: http://mformiscellaneous.blogspot.com/
"At a dinner party one should eat wisely but not too well, and talk well but not too wisely."--W. Somerset Maugham Reply With Quote September 1st, 2010, 07:19 PM #8 Cameronc ADBB Amateur Atkins Phase: 14-day Induction
Join Date Aug 30, 2010 Posts 9 Rep Power 0 Re: Fried Chicken = High Carb Count? Originally Posted by not2late Are you making these thighs yourself or are you purchasing them? Making them
Also, looks like El pollo loco is carb free when ordered ala carte Share Share this post on Digg Del.icio.us Technorati Twitter
Reply With Quote September 1st, 2010, 07:29 PM #9 liv Moderator Atkins Phase: Maintenance S/C/G: 75/57/57 GOAL
Join Date Nov 21, 2007 Location Canada Posts 20,606 Blog Entries 9 Images 93 My Mood Rep Power 471 Re: Fried Chicken = High Carb Count? Originally Posted by Cameronc I've searched a few sources and it seems as though Fried Chicken Thighs have high carb counts?
Where are these carbs coming from?
Chicken thighs, seasoned with Salt&Pepper and deep fried?
(from another forum) Fried chicken drumsticks or thighs 2 pieces (about 5 1/4 oz.) 15.7 g those are number from carb counts all over the net. That is carb counts from breaded chicken bought at a fast food restaurant. And yes breaded chicken from fast food restauratns will have that many carbs. Share Share this post on Digg Del.icio.us Technorati Twitter
